repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Convention photographs and photographs of Bruno C. Brunelli.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection reflects Brunelli's work with the Textile Workers Union of America, Local 454, at the American Felt Co. in Franklin, Mass. Includes correspondence, 1948-1950; bylaws, 1960; audits, 1954 and 1960; financial reports, 1949-1953, of Local 454; cash books, 1943-1944; cancelled checks, 1942-1958; and check stubs, 1947-1955. Also contains monthly cash report ledgers, 1942-1956; copies of collective bargaining agreements between TWUA and various New England companies, 1950-1970; and documents pertaining to union activities at American Felt.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

did.unittitle: Textile Workers Union Eleventh Biennial Convention and Bruno C. Brunelli at a Mill
Item 1: Four attendees at the Eleventh Biennial Convention, Textile Workers Union of America AFL-CIO, CLC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Central Studios, 625 Atlantic Ave., Atlantic City, N.J., [photographer]. Gelatin silver print, May 30-June 3, 1960. Image depicts four men attending the Eleventh Biennial Convention of the Textile Workers Union of America, AFL-CIO, CLC, held in Chicago, Ill., from May 30 to June 3, 1960. The man standing second from the right is identified on the reverse of the photo as Bruno C. Brunelli, who was president of C.I.O. Local 454, Textile Workers Union of America, at American Felt Co., Franklin, Mass. 25.25 x 20.5 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 2: Bruno C. Brunelli and another attendee at the Eleventh Biennial Convention, Textile Workers Union of America AFL-CIO, CLC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Central Studios, 625 Atlantic Ave., Atlantic City, N.J., [photographer]. Gelatin silver print, May 30-June 3, 1960. Image depicts Bruno C. Brunelli and another attendee at the Eleventh Biennial Convention of the Textile Workers Union of America, AFL-CIO, CLC, held in Chicago, Ill., from May 30 to June 3, 1960. Brunelli, who was president of C.I.O. Local 454, Textile Workers Union of America, at American Felt Co., Franklin, Mass., is on the left; the other man is unidentified. Other men and women visible in the background. 25.25 x 20.5 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 3: Bruno C. Brunelli and other men in an unidentified mill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph by Sheldon A. Glew, 29 Myrtle Street, Framingham, Mass. Gelatin silver print, Aug. 10, 1948. Image depicts Bruno C. Brunelli, who was president of C.I.O. Local 454, Textile Workers Union of America, at American Felt Co., Franklin, Mass., on the far right of a group of men who are unidentified. Older man sitting in front of the group at a table with sheets of paper and a pen on it; possibly the signing of something? Mill location is also unidentified. 25.5 x 20.5 cm.

did.unittitle: Large Group Photographs and a Poster of Bruno C. Brunelli
Item 1: 8th Annual Convention, Mass. State C.I.O.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Worcester, Mass. Metropolitan Photo, 25 Huntington Ave., Boston, photographer. Gelatin silver print, Dec. 5-7, 1946. Image depicts a group photograph at the 8th annual convention of the Massachusetts State C.I.O, held in the Municipal Auditorium in Worcester, Mass., Dec. 5, 6, 7, 1946. Large hall filled with delegates (overwhelmingly men) sitting at long tables. Stage at the rear holds a podium with a man behind it and a number of other men standing on the stage. Photograph is blurry and overexposed in the right-hand corner. 50 x 25.5 cm.

did.unittitle: Item 2: Testimonial dinner to Maurice Tobin, Secretary of Labor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Boston, Mass. Fay Foto, Boston, photographer. Gelatin silver print, May 7, 1949. Image depicts the testimonial dinner given for Maurice Tobin, Secretary of Labor, at the Statler Hotel, Boston, Mass., May 7, 1949, sponsored by the United Labor Committee of Mass. Photo shows hall filled with attendees seated at round tables, along with more visible in the balcony on the left. A large number of men and some women are standing behind two long banquet tables on the stage at the rear of the hall. 50.5 x 25.5 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Poster with photo showing recognition of Bruno Brunelli in Carding Department for his conscientious efforts in fulfilling the Zero Defects Program objectives. Poster, [mid-20th century]. Image shows Brunelli operating machinery. 43 x 55.5 cm.
